channel.title: Help me!
channel.description:
hello.. i need help with
1- dungeoneering cape i can wear it and I'm level one
2- max cape or completionist cape i can wear it and I'm level one
3-interface in smithing cant see bars to make it
please i realy need help please please help me
in teamviwer please
skype (mark.rs3)

item.title: Help me!
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

Please rephrase your statements so people can understand you.

  1. Find the files in your source that have to do with item requirements, it doesn’t matter the name of the file, if you find it, you find it.
  2. Identify in the file where it starts handling requirements.
  3. Replicate it and change the variables so it meets your needs.

If it’s in ItemConstants, then change it in ItemConstants. I don’t know your source, so wherever it fits, put it there.

Read full topic

item.title: Help me!
item.dc:creator: @KAJ0 KAJ0
item.description:

but someone tell me i can add that in itemconstants but i dont know how to add it please help

Read full topic

item.title: Help me!
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

Or you could just reverse the logic with the logical complement operator. if (!player.getSkills().getTotalLevel(player) >= 2475) { player.getPackets().sendGameMessage("You need a total level of 2475 to wear this cape."); player.getPackets().sendGameMessage("You need 99 in all skills to wear this cape."); }[quote=“KAJ0, post:12, topic:533828”]so where i add that
if (player.getSkills().getTotalLevel(player) >= 2475) {
player.getPackets().sendGameMessage(“You need a total level of 2475 to wear this cape.”);
player.getPackets().sendGameMessage(“You need 99 in all skills to wear this cape.”);
}[/quote]With what you previous told me, I’d assume in the InventoryOptionsHandler class.

Read full topic

item.title: Help me!
item.dc:creator: @B0SS B0SS
item.description:
@B0SS wrote:

[quote=“Null Amount, post:10, topic:533828”]Let’s take a look.[quote]if (player.getSkills().getTotalLevel(player) >= 2475) { player.getPackets().sendGameMessage("You need a total level of 2475 to wear this cape."); player.getPackets().sendGameMessage("You need 99 in all skills to wear this cape."); }[/quote]
If the player has a total level of 2475 or higher, would it make sense for it to send the player a message saying that they need a total level of 2475/99 in all skills? Hint: exclamation point reverses the logic, or basically saying “not”.[/quote]so instead of the >
would it be like this?

if (player.getSkills().getTotalLevel(player) <= 2475) { player.getPackets().sendGameMessage("You need a total level of 2475 to wear this cape."); player.getPackets().sendGameMessage("You need 99 in all skills to wear this cape."); }

Read full topic

item.title: Help me!
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

Let’s take a look.

if (player.getSkills().getTotalLevel(player) >= 2475) { player.getPackets().sendGameMessage("You need a total level of 2475 to wear this cape."); player.getPackets().sendGameMessage("You need 99 in all skills to wear this cape."); }

If the player has a total level of 2475 or higher, would it make sense for it to send the player a message saying that they need a total level of 2475/99 in all skills? Hint: exclamation point reverses the logic, or basically saying “not”.

Read full topic

item.title: Help me!
item.dc:creator: @B0SS B0SS
item.description:
@B0SS wrote:

	[code]}else if (item.getId() == 20767//max cape
			|| item.getId() == 20768) {//max hood
		if (player.getSkills().getTotalLevel(player) >= 2475) {
			player.getPackets().sendGameMessage("You need a total level of 2475 to wear this cape.");
			player.getPackets().sendGameMessage("You need 99 in all skills to wear this cape.");
	}
	if (!player.getQuestManager().completedQuest(Quests.NOMADS_REQUIEM)) {
			player.getPackets().sendGameMessage("You need to complete the quest: Nomad's Requiem, to wear this cape.");
	if (!player.isCompletedFightKiln())
			player.getPackets().sendGameMessage("You need to complete the Fight Kiln and have obtained the Tokhaar-Kal, to wear this cape.");
	if (!player.isKilledQueenBlackDragon())
			player.getPackets().sendGameMessage("You need to kill the Queen Black Dragon and have recieved the First Dragonkin-Journal to wear this cape.");
                           return false;
	}[/code]

theres atleast one part of it, if you dont have that.

EDIT:Changed the code

Read full topic
